column1: #Text=Crowborough is a town in East Sussex near the border with Kent , in the South East of England .

#Text=Crowborough is a small town on the edge of Ashdown Forest that has grown up on and around Beacon Hill , so named for the flaming beacon used in past times to warn London of attacks on England 's southern coast .
#Text=The beacon can still be seen today , beside the running track at Goldsmith 's Leisure Centre .
#Text=Crowborough is best known for being home to Sir Arthur Conan Doyle .
#Text=The main road into Crowborough is the A26 , which runs from Tunbridge Wells in the north to Brighton on the south coast .
#Text=is some distance from the centre of town , in adjacent Jarvis Brook .
#Text=The train line goes north to London Bridge , and south as far as Uckfield .
#Text=Fare and timetable information is available from Southern Trains , tel . 08457 484950 .
#Text=The centre of Crowborough is very small , and can be covered on foot in quite a short time .
#Text=As with most other towns in England , the town is well serviced by buses and taxis .
#Text=Arriva operates a half hourly 229 service between Crowborough and Tunbridge Wells .
#Text=Timetables and fares are available on their website .
#Text=Buy your ticket from the driver when you board the bus .
#Text=this service does not operate on evenings or Sundays

#Text=Brighton & Hove operate a half-hourly service between Brighton and Tunbridge Wells , with the 29 's running straight through Crowborough on the A26 while the 29A diverts and serves Whitehill and Crowborough town centre .
#Text=Crow and Gate , Uckfield Rd , Crowborough ( out of town to the west ) , ☏ +441892603461 .
#Text=pub with food and garden mains from £6 .
